sub_title: Assistant Professor at TU Delft | Circular Education & Social Relevance of Circularity | CBE Hub Member
summary: My main research lies in architectural education and knowledge creation within the extended communities of knowledge. I am currently focused on circular economy and in particular the role of circularity in design from a systems perspective and the way it reorganizes both the educational experience and architectural design practice. For more on my research please visit: https://ioannouolga.blog/

contributors.headline: Assistant Professor at TU Delft | Circular Education & Social Relevance of Circularity | CBE Hub Member

projects.title: Reinventing public space in Greece; current tendencies and future capital
projects.description:
A series of architectural competitions in urban scale that were recently implemented in the major cities of Greece illustrate a sudden reemergence of public interest in regards to public space while at the same the ideas proposed have ignited a new debate on how the Greek people perceive life in the open. 
What was once an overlooked entity shaped casually by what was left between private buildings and streets, public space is now beginning to be reconsidered and renegotiated as a common space of mutual interaction; a tendency that has already been registered in the numerous initiatives of various groups of people that have taken up on the challenge to help reluctant Greek citizens make amends with their built environment.
The competition boom addressed two main issues that included the redesigning of rather sensitive areas of historical/archeological importance and the reemergence of public spaces that by the years had become abandoned and therefore, obsolete. 
What is interesting about this series of interventions is that they show how the big cities have started to acknowledge and renegotiate their identity and how they aspire to relate to others. In most examples the orientation of the design has been to feature historical and archeological sites with direct address to incoming tourists while in other cases, what has been under scrutiny is the upgrade of the city’s profile in everyday life.

contributors.headline: Assistant Professor at TU Delft | Circular Education & Social Relevance of Circularity | CBE Hub Member

projects.title: Structuring Online Learning Collectivities
projects.description:
What appeared to be a technological breakthrough in education is now irrevocably changing the subject itself. The initial goal of equality in education as introduced by Massive Open Online Courses (MOOCs) has been extended beyond the rise in the number of learners to the actual consideration of them as individuals of equal intelligence who are aware of this fact and therefore, emancipated from the traditional forms of education by instruction. The new subject these courses refer to is not simply accumulating knowledge; it is creating it. And by doing so, it is creating the intellectual tools it will be using in the future not just in the educational context but in the real world problem posing and solving. 
Keywords— Education; MOOCs; Online learning collectivities; equality; emancipation; equality

Assistant Professor at Deree The American College of Greece, Architectural, Planning and Tourism, Consultant

projects.title: “Roll Productions" Offices
projects.description:
In 2011 Roll Productions  decided to reinvent it self by moving to a totally new environment so the office was asked to design its new studios to fit the company’s new profile. The idea was to maintain the soundproof isolated premises –necessary for all multimedia activities that take place within- but to also enrich them with common spaces where employees could interact and circulate.  
Situated at the second floor of an office building in Marousi and despite its awkward outline as illustrated in the plan, the final layout allows maximum use of the separate rooms, yet a central core is created, a distorted corridor, that allows those working inside the rooms to interact during intervals. 
While the rooms maintain their solid character the upper part is handled more freely by lightweight demountable partitions with glazed modules that permit the entrance of natural light in the central corridor.

Architect Ing. NTUA, MArch Harvard University GSD, Docent at Technische Universiteit Delft

projects.title: Detached Summer Houses in Aegina
projects.description: The site belongs to a family with three children aged between 15 and 28 and the design was intended in a way that each one of them eventually gets his own private residence in the site. The three different volumes emerge from the different needs of each future inhabitant yet they intersect at first level and reunite in a common terrace with a breathtaking sea view. All construction is planned to the last detail in order to be realized with sustainable materials and by using local contractors to minimize costs.

projects.title: Magikon Ltd Offices
projects.description:
In 2009 the office undertook the design and construction of the new offices of Magikon Ltd in Athens. Placed at the ground floor of a small-scale office building in Marousi, the company that engages in the production of animated TV commercials needed a new and highly equipped conference room. Due to the long meetings usually held between the various parties responsible for such commercials, this room needed to provide a calm and relaxing environment while equipped with multiple high tech sound and vision systems to ensure the best possible conditions for the presentations of the company’s projects to its clients.
Apart from the main premise that can host up to 16 people, two additional workstations were needed as mush as a separate office for the manager and coordinator of the meetings. The basement was also occupied by the company as extra space but the ground floor needed to be self sufficient so a kitchenette and a small bathroom were added. The stairs that connect the two floors are hidden behind the colored lacquered panels adjacent to the main entrance while all materials used in this project remain as subtle and neutral as possible like the pvc flooring also used in its continuity as wall covering. Instead of solid walls, two gliding glazed partitions separate the conference room offering the possibility to open and use the room’s space in its entirety when needed.

contributors.headline: Assistant Professor at TU Delft | Circular Education & Social Relevance of Circularity | CBE Hub Member

projects.title: Intersalonika Vehicle Maintenance Facility
projects.description:
In late 2008 Intersalonika acquired an old warehouse aspiring to make it one of the largest vehicle maintenance facilities of Northern Greece. The original building consisted of two levels -almost identical in plan-, the basement and the ground floor. The need was to increase the surface by adding two more levels. This way the vehicles would move in the lower floors while the upper floors would serve as storage space for the facility’s needs. Office space was also needed for the appropriate personnel supporting service as well as space for leisure for those guests waiting to pick up their cars. The permits were issued at the beginning of 2010 and construction was concluded in the spring of 2011. 
The building is approximately 70m long and 50m wide and it has been covered with two different kinds of insulation panels in grey and white. The circumscribing eaves of the building has been also covered in etalbond panels in blue and grey -the company’s identity colors-. 
The oblique covering is used as a means to decrease the sense of enormity of the monolithic volume and the differentiation of color of the panels stands for exactly the same purpose. 
One can enter the building from all sides but clients are meant to stay in just one part of it, the one that is parallel to the main street and where all the offices are situated. 
Glass walls in the waiting area instead of solid partitions allow the client to watch the cars being fixed in the inner area where all the machinery and equipment are held.

contributors.headline: Assistant Professor at TU Delft | Circular Education & Social Relevance of Circularity | CBE Hub Member

projects.title: Light PLus Retail Shop
projects.description: In the autumn of 2007 Light Plus commissioned the design and construction of its retail shop for lighting and furniture in Athens.  The general idea was to design a neutral space with various solutions for storage to host numerous objects of all scales and dimensions. The multiple levels and partitions used helped the exhibition space by offering a wide range of possible positions for the objects and different eye views of them all around the place.

contributors.headline: Assistant Professor at TU Delft | Circular Education & Social Relevance of Circularity | CBE Hub Member

projects.title: Intertravel Travel Agency
projects.description: In 2008 Intersalonika commissioned the renovation of one of its retail shops that served as a travel agency mostly for the company’s employees. The scope was to expand the shop’s activities and enrich its clientele.  The design ensured the maximum exploitation of the limited surface and the creation of a second floor destined for the planning of holidays and special packages where more privacy is required.
